appears on your pages ?
* headings : HTML has six "levels" of
headings:

* paragraphs : ` <p>` To create a paragraph , for bold words ` <b> `, for  italic words ` <i>` to contain characters  ` <sup> ` ,to contain characters  ` <sub> `, *White Space*  :
 > In order to make code easier to
read, web page authors often
add extra spaces or start some
elements on new lines .
## Visual Editors & Their Code views
> Content management systems and HTML editors such as Dreamweaver
usually have two views of the page you are creating: a visual editor and a
code view.

` <s> ` ` <ins> ` ` <del> ` ` <ins> `
` <del> ` ` <dfn> ` ` <cite> ` ` <abbr> ` ` <abbr> ``<q>`  

They also provide semantic information .

(p226-p245 ch 10 html&css book)
### how CSS works ?
css have tow parts :
 1. selector :ndicate which
element the rule applies to
2. a declaration: specify the settings
you want to use for the chosen
properties. 
CSS Selectors:
![](https://i.pinimg.com/originals/bc/97/96/bc97965579512f8a6d2303934f599c65.png)


CSS : treats each HTML element as if it appears inside
its own box and s usually appear in a separate document,
although they may appear within an HTML page.

(p53-p84 ch 2 jss book)
#### Basic Java scribt intro
java scribt :
 > GIVING INSTRUCTIONS FOR ABROWSER TO FOLLOW.
 Scripts contain very precise instructions. For example,
you might specify that a value must be remembered
before creating a calculation using that value. 
  comments : help youto explain what your code does.
and make your code easier to read and understand.
the variables:
The result is said to
be calculated or computed using the data stored in .
DATA TYPES:
variable,Booleans,NUMERIC, STRING.
arrays:
array is a special type of variable. It doesn't
just store one value; it stores a list of values .

Expressions:  rely on things called operators; they allow programmers to
create a single value from one or more values. 
operators :

decisions about what to do next by using typs of  operators :
Comparison operators.
